importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement of the Netflix series, indicating when the public learned about this new production involving the Kennedy family.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, beginning with Joe and Rose Kennedy’s rise and tracing the family’s ascent through the early decades of the 20th century, including the formative years leading up to John F. Kennedy’s presidency.

keyTakeAways: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956.'
The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and explores the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family across generations.
The show begins in the 1930s and charts the rise of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack, who struggles to escape the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy.
The series is described as a blend of American mythology and personal drama, offering insight into the human struggles behind the Kennedy legend.
It will run for eight episodes and is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr.
The showrunner, Sam Shaw, emphasizes the relevance of the Kennedys to understanding American history and current societal values.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netflix is the company that announced and will be producing the new Kennedy family series, making it central to the story's production and distribution.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is cast as Joe Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy family, bringing significant star power and credibility to the series.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy family
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series centers on the Kennedy family’s history, including their political influence, personal tragedies, and cultural mythology in American history.

namedEntities.name: John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a central figure in the Kennedy family narrative, symbolizing the political legacy and tragic history that the series explores.

namedEntities.name: Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Father of John F. Kennedy and patriarch of the Kennedy family
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the character played by Michael Fassbender, forming the foundation of the narrative that traces the family’s rise and internal tensions.

namedEntities.name: Rose Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Wife of Joe Kennedy, Sr., mother of John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is a key figure in the family’s rise and is part of the narrative of Joe and Rose Kennedy’s journey in the 1930s.

namedEntities.name: Jack Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Second son of Joe and Rose Kennedy, later U.S. President
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is portrayed as a rebellious figure struggling against the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy, highlighting internal family dynamics.

namedEntities.name: Robert F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Youthful brother of John F. Kennedy, later U.S. Senator and presidential hopeful
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is referenced as a key figure in the family’s internal conflict and political legacy, with the show exploring the tension between siblings.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Author of the biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His book serves as the source material for the series, providing historical depth and narrative foundation.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the creative lead responsible for developing the narrative and articulating the show’s thematic significance.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: TV producer known for historical dramas
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is mentioned as the creator of an upcoming 'American Love Story' focusing on JFK Jr., contrasting with the new Netflix series.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son of John F. Kennedy, who died in a plane crash in 1999
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His death and the tragic plane crash are cited as part of the Kennedy family’s 'curse,' reinforcing the series’ focus on tragedy and legacy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography of the Kennedy family, set to star Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr. The series begins in the 1930s and follows the rise of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack and Robert F. Kennedy, exploring both their political ambitions and personal tragedies. The show aims to humanize the Kennedy mythos by revealing the family’s struggles, dynamics, and emotional burdens, offering a nuanced look at American political history. It will run for eight episodes and will be distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming series on JFK Jr., highlighting the Kennedy family's enduring cultural significance in American life.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
